alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Jackson; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:06PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Whiteside, Carroll, northeastern Rock Island, northeastern Scott, eastern Clinton and southeastern Jackson Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 603 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Savanna to Albany. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Garden Plain and East Clinton around 610 PM CDT. Mount Carroll around 615 PM CDT. Argo Fay around 620 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Lanark, Fairhaven, Chadwick, Lyndon, Milledgeville and Coleta. This includes Interstate 88 between mile markers 20 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Illinois...and east central Iowa.
